result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan L Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Megan L Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Megan L Miller was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Megan L Miller was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety except for prescribed medications.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

ADDRESS INFO for Megan L Miller
Current: 878 3rd Street, Menasha, WI 54952 United States  (Effective: 01-07-2022)
Prior: 512 Main St, Brillion, WI 54110
RE:  Possess Psilocybin with intent to deliver, on 12-23-21.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess schedule I or II narcotics, 2 counts bail jumping, resist/obstruct officer, possess Psilocybin with intent to deliver.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-31-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she have no contact with Thomas Lischka and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
